xxl.core.relational.cursors
Class NestedLoopsDistinct

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.cursors.AbstractCursor<E>
      xxl.core.cursors.distincts.NestedLoopsDistinct<Tuple>
          xxl.core.relational.cursors.NestedLoopsDistinct
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Iterator<Tuple>, Cursor<Tuple>, MetaDataCursor<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>>
public class NestedLoopsDistinct
extends NestedLoopsDistinct<Tuple>
implements MetaDataCursor<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>>

A nested-loops implementation of the operator "Distinct". This class uses the algorithm of NestedLoopsDistinct and additionally forwards the metadata.

Depending on the specified memory size and object size as many elements as possible will be inserted into a temporal bag (typically located in main memory). To guarantee that no duplicates will be inserted the bag is searched for duplicates with the help of a predicate specified in the constructor. If not all elements can be inserted into the bag they will be stored in a queue and will be inserted when the bag emptied due to calls to this.next().

Example: 

   new NestedLoopsDistinct<Object>(cursor, 100000, 200);
       // 100000: amount of memory used in Bytes
       // 200: size of each Tuple
This distinct-operator handles up to (100000/200)-1 tuples in main memory at one time. Additional tuples will be stored in a bag.

Constructor Detail

NestedLoopsDistinct

public NestedLoopsDistinct(MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>> cursor,
                           int memSize,
                           int objectSize,
                           Predicate<? super Tuple> predicate,
                           Function<?,? extends Bag<Tuple>> newBag,
                           Function<?,? extends Queue<Tuple>> newQueue)
Creates a new nested-loops distinct operator. Determines the maximum number of elements that can be stored in the bag used for the temporal storage of the elements of the input cursor: 
   maxTuples = memSize / objectSize - 1
.

Parameters:
cursor - the input metadata cursor delivering the elements.
memSize - the available memory size (bytes) for the bag.
objectSize - the size (bytes) needed to store one element.
predicate - the predicate returning true if two elements are equal.
newBag - a function without parameters returning an empty bag whose bag.cursor() must support remove().
newQueue - a function without parameters returning an empty queue.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if not enough memory is available.

NestedLoopsDistinct

public NestedLoopsDistinct(MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>> cursor,
                           int memSize,
                           int objectSize)
Creates a new nested-loops distinct operator. Determines the maximum number of elements that can be stored in the bag used for the temporal storage of the elements of the input cursor: 
   maxTuples = memSize / objectSize - 1
. Uses the Predicate Equal.DEFAULT_INSTANCE and default factory methods for the classes list-bags and array-queues.

Parameters:
cursor - the input metadata cursor delivering the elements.
memSize - the available memory size (bytes) for the bag.
objectSize - the size (bytes) needed to store one element.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if not enough memory is available.

NestedLoopsDistinct

public NestedLoopsDistinct(java.sql.ResultSet resultSet,
                           int memSize,
                           int objectSize,
                           Predicate<? super Tuple> predicate,
                           Function<?,? extends Bag<Tuple>> newBag,
                           Function<?,? extends Queue<Tuple>> newQueue)
Creates a new nested-loops distinct operator. Determines the maximum number of elements that can be stored in the bag used for the temporal storage of the elements of the input result set: 
   maxTuples = memSize / objectSize - 1
.

Parameters:
resultSet - the input rsult set delivering the elements. The result set is wrapped to a metadata cursor using ResultSetMetaDataCursor.
memSize - the available memory size (bytes) for the bag.
objectSize - the size (bytes) needed to store one element.
predicate - the predicate returning true if two elements are equal.
newBag - a function without parameters returning an empty bag whose bag.cursor() must support remove().
newQueue - a function without parameters returning an empty queue.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if not enough memory is available.

public NestedLoopsDistinct(java.sql.ResultSet resultSet,
                           int memSize,
                           int objectSize)
Creates a new nested-loops distinct operator. Determines the maximum number of elements that can be stored in the bag used for the temporal storage of the elements of the input result set: 
   maxTuples = memSize / objectSize - 1
. Uses the Predicate Equal.DEFAULT_INSTANCE and default factory methods for the classes list-bags and array-queues.

Parameters:
resultSet - the input rsult set delivering the elements. The result set is wrapped to a metadata cursor using ResultSetMetaDataCursor.
memSize - the available memory size (bytes) for the bag.
objectSize - the size (bytes) needed to store one element.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if not enough memory is available.
